items.title: cyclic dependency on itself
items.body:
I have a library which uses something from extras in its setup.py.

My lib has this in setup.py:

```
from extras import RunFlakesCommand

setup(
    name='mylib',
    packages=find_packages(),
    setup_requires=['extras'],
    tests_require=tests_require,
    cmdclass={'flakes': RunFlakesCommand},
)
```

then when I run

```
python setup.py test
```

I get this error:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "setup.py", line 51, in <module>
    cmdclass={'flakes': RunFlakesCommand},
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/distutils/core.py", line 113, in setup
    _setup_distribution = dist = klass(attrs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/setuptools/dist.py", line 268, in __init__
    self.fetch_build_eggs(attrs['setup_requires'])
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/setuptools/dist.py", line 312, in fetch_build_eggs
    replace_conflicting=True,
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 846, in resolve
    dist = best[req.key] = env.best_match(req, ws, installer)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 1091, in best_match
    return self.obtain(req, installer)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 1103, in obtain
    return installer(requirement)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/setuptools/dist.py", line 379, in fetch_build_egg
    return cmd.easy_install(req)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/setuptools/command/easy_install.py", line 639, in easy_install
    return self.install_item(spec, dist.location, tmpdir, deps)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/setuptools/command/easy_install.py", line 669, in install_item
    dists = self.install_eggs(spec, download, tmpdir)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/setuptools/command/easy_install.py", line 852, in install_eggs
    return self.build_and_install(setup_script, setup_base)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/setuptools/command/easy_install.py", line 1080, in build_and_install
    self.run_setup(setup_script, setup_base, args)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/setuptools/command/easy_install.py", line 1066, in run_setup
    run_setup(setup_script, args)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/setuptools/sandbox.py", line 242, in run_setup
    raise
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/contextlib.py", line 34, in __exit__
    self.gen.throw(type, value, traceback)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/setuptools/sandbox.py", line 195, in setup_context
    yield
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/contextlib.py", line 34, in __exit__
    self.gen.throw(type, value, traceback)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/setuptools/sandbox.py", line 166, in save_modules
    saved_exc.resume()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/setuptools/sandbox.py", line 141, in resume
    compat.reraise(type, exc, self._tb)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/setuptools/sandbox.py", line 154, in save_modules
    yield saved
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/setuptools/sandbox.py", line 195, in setup_context
    yield
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/setuptools/sandbox.py", line 239, in run_setup
    DirectorySandbox(setup_dir).run(runner)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/setuptools/sandbox.py", line 269, in run
    return func()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/setuptools/sandbox.py", line 238, in runner
    _execfile(setup_script, ns)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/setuptools/sandbox.py", line 46, in _execfile
    exec(code, globals, locals)
  File "/tmp/easy_install-Ssf68p/extras-0.0.3/setup.py", line 8, in <module>
    'README.rst'))
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'try_import'
```

items.title: extras does not conform to PEP 396
items.body:
For our package management we use automated tooling to extract version numbers from python packages. I would like to request that you change the `__version__` attribute so that it conforms to PEP 396. Currently `__version__` returns a tuple according to PEP 396 it should return a string.

[PEP 396](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0396/) states:
- When a module (or package) includes a version number, the version SHOULD be available in the `__version__` attribute.
- The `__version__` attribute's value SHOULD be a string.

items.title: test requirements not documented
items.body:
When trying to run the unit tests I received the following error: 

```
make check
PYTHONPATH=/home/ddriddle/src/extras python -m testtools.run extras.tests.test_suite
/services/scratch/ddriddle/src/extras/venv/bin/python: No module named testtools
make: *** [check] Error 1
```

This is because extras requires that `testtools` be installed to run the unit tests. This is not documented. Many python projects have a `dev-requirements.txt` file to document the required testing software. I would ask that you add a `dev-requriements.txt` file.
